intro: Cheiridopsis speciosa, commonly known as the showy ice plant, is a succulent native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, ribbed leaves and vibrant, daisy-like flowers. The plant is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves. It produces small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Cheiridopsis speciosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
